Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Sid D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Germain downtown Toronto is probably one of the most classiest hotels in the downtown core. It is conveniently located and I was able to get to all my meetings and sporting events so quickly. I love the service and the in house breakfast, as well as the the late night dining/bar area. Restaurants, Clubs, and work were all a breeze to get to, and also the CN tower was about a 15 minute walk away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. The rooms are luxurious and the showers are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... as always”
Reviews.Author: LondonWorldClass
Reviews.Content: I travel up from the Caribbean each year and this is the 3rd or 4th time I have stayed at Le Germain. It is always a great experience. From the welcome to the room to the restaurant they deliver a great experience. In the rooms they have really comfy beds, the wireless is free and fast which is great for a business traveller like me and the work space is comfortable and efficient. The have a lounge area downstairs that is very homey with great coffee on tap making a great place to host a meeting if you need to. Overall it's a great experience and that's why I keep going back. Thanks to the team there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: We checked in the early hours of the morning after a very delayed flight. The staff at the front counter were lovely and we got into our rooms ASAP. We were on our honeymoon and there was dessert plate in the room with a card and a small gift, which was a lovely surprise!! The beds were comfortable and room was very modern with good lighting options, iPod dock and nespresso machine. Bathroom was lovely and big. Good location, especially to union station. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and very good stay, but not as great as in the past”
Reviews.Author: weezeroo
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very good weekend stay at Le Germain to celebrate our wedding anniversary and would recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, modern Toronto hotel in a great location. That said, we felt some of the "polish" we loved about the hotel from earlier stays was missing, at least this weekend. We arrived at the hotel about 2:00 pm on a Saturday and pulled our car outside the main entrance. We waited for several minutes for a valet/bellman, but no one came out. We unloaded our bags from the trunk and put them on the curb, but still no one from the hotel came. We started to carry in our bags, but couldn't juggle them plus the hotel doors. Once we were partly inside, the concierge came over - she was very pleasant and helped us inside. At the check-in desk, we were told the bellman was "someplace else" but someone would park our car when he returned. I thought we might have just arrived at a legitimately poor time while everyone was busy. In our past stays, there has always been someone there greeting guests, holding the door, helping with bags or luggage, etc. However, I can honestly say throughout our stay, there was never a bellman at the front door. It's not a major deal-breaker, and maybe the 10 or so times we past through the front doors were all "off" times - still, it's something that really struck us as odd and really something we missed. At check in, I asked whether the hotel could help us with arranging transportation to dinner that night - the gentleman was very polite, but told me they hotel didn't provide transportation but that I would be able to hail a cab myself in front of the hotel. Again, this isn't a major deal, but I found it to be odd and not quite the response I expected. I should also be fair and say when we came downstairs to go to dinner, we talked to the same concierge who helped us through the front doors and she called a cab for us. I want to stress the hotel is beautiful, modern, and in a great location. The fireplace in the lobby was always very welcoming when we came in from the cold. We had drinks and food in Victor twice and found the staff to be very friendly and the food very good. We also ordered room service which was delivered very quick and was excellent as well. We really appreciated the included in-room WiFi, which worked flawlessly. I think the best way to sum up our review is that we previously never gave any thought to staying at any other hotel in Toronto besides Le Germain. In the past, we always felt like we couldn't find better in the city. We very well might stay at Le Germain again and hope this was just an off weekend - however, we will likely at least consider staying at another property next time, which is something we wouldn't have considered before.

Reviews.Title: “The choice is easy.”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: its rare you go to a hotel and everything works perfectly and the staff are terrific. The rooms are big and well equipped, the internet works, and the included breakfast is great. I often refer to my stays at Le Germain as flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: mgwebber
Reviews.Content: I work for SAY: Media, a digital media company and travel 30-35 weeks/year so I have seen my fair share of boutique hotels in Canada & the US, and none compare to the quality of Le Germain on Mercer St. in Toronto. The vibe of the lobby is perfect for relaxing & getting some work done by the fire, the rooms are spacious, beautiful and i always sleep well there, the food is excellent, the location is killer - near all tourist attractions in Toronto and nestled into the theatre district, so near great shopping, amazing restaurants, TIFF etc etc. But the real reason that I stay at this hotel is the service. These folks are highly trained and really care. The staff are kind and respectful and it just sets the bar for how lovely a hotel can be. its in the details & this hotel has it.

Reviews.Title: “modern, elegant but friendly”
Reviews.Author: PghAnnie
Reviews.Content: Rooms are cool modern spaces, glass, concrete, blonde wood, marble. Glass walled, high tech shower, marble floor tiles and counters. Neat ambient lighting, Window wall view of CN tower with its nightly light show. Blond wood desk and closets. Welcome tray of fruit and bon-bons. The concierge was lovely and pleasant, arranged for the hotel car to take us to a restaurant on a bitterly cold night and also researched a few things for us. The 24-hour coffee lounge is very attractive, and has the added benefit of a view of the Rogers Center outside jumbotron, so you can catch a Leafs game out the window while sipping your espresso. European-style breakfast buffet served in this area is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Krissy S
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Le Germain was extremely accommodating, allowing both an early check-in as well as a late check-out! Everyone I interacted with was extremely welcoming, courteous, and genuinely kind. I very much enjoyed my stay and will certainly be staying at Le Germain exclusively whenever I am in Toronto. I loved the bed and the bathroom was luxurious! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: malatestiano
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, great customer service, very conveniently located. I just spent 2 nights in Toronto for a business trip and have to say that I'm super impressed! From the doorman to the reception desk staff to the bartenders to the waitstaff at breakfast, everybody was always super helpful and pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff, great location and overall enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: RedSeaNomad
Reviews.Content: After a long international flight, it was a relief to enter a real fire-place and be greeted by polite staff. The rooms were taistfully furnished (despite some unbecoming marks on the ceiling) with comfortable bed and the all important nesspresso machine. If there was any complaint it was the limited options for breakfast, however with so many eateries nearby it's not a great hardship. I used tripadvisor find this and many other hotels, so this is to give something back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Way to Celebrate a Special Occassion”
Reviews.Author: NickyandMichael
Reviews.Content: My fiancee booked a night stay at this hotel on Dec 11 to celebrate our anniversary and every penny he spent was worth it Arrival/Check in: Very smooth. Received an upgrade. We were surprised by a plate of desserts & fruits in our room and small thank you note from the concierge. My fiancee got flowers delivered in the room prior to coming in, which they were happy to accomodate. Living Area: We got suite on the 7th floor *(recommend) that has a huge balcony (extending from the room to the living area). Living area has an LCD TV, 2 sets of couches and a cozy fire place. A small kitchen with a sink, a fridge which includes water bottles, milk & butter and a nespresso coffee machine with various coffee disc. Lots of cups & tissues. There is also small dining area. You dont really need to get out of your room Rooms: Very Spacious Tons of closet space. Had a huge TV with boss speakers & Ipod dock. Bed sheets are super high quality and the pillows are down & very soft. You really do not want to get out of bed once you lie down. Also a great view of the balcony and living area. Washrooms Powder room by the entrance and a huge washroom suite. A stand up shower and a bathtub with complimentary bath necessities. Gym: A couple of thread mills/ elliptical /weights and a small mini-put golf. Great view. Area: Hotel is located at king west district and is a quick step from great restaurants and lounges on the weekend. Approx. a 5 minute walk on restaurants towards the west side (italians pubs, fusion) and about 10-15 minute walk on restaurants on Front Street ( such as Jack asstors, Canyon Creek) Overall Experience: You have everything you need in the room and maybe even more. It is not your average hotel; you will find these kind of amenities only at this hotel. The atmosphere of the room gives you a homey feeling that you don't want to leave. When we did went out, we could not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ZaraWesternCanada
Reviews.Content: Beautiful interiors. Feels like a boutique hotel. Modern and warm rooms, great linens and comfy beds. Library in lobby has wood burning fire place and a high end coffee machine for tea and coffee any time. (no in-room coffee). Nice breakfast room for a light breakfast. Near good restaurant options. Would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: *Mark*J*L*
Reviews.Content: This place had everything I look for in a big city: Decent sized room with space to work and free wi-fi (how some some chains like Hilton can still charge money is beyond me), a walk-in shower with glass walls not a cramped tub with a nasty curtain, attentive and polite staff and a decent bar/restaurant. A plus was that the coffee machine in the room made great espresso. On the downside on several evenings during my stay the bar was being used for exterior events so was not available for residents - service was being provided in the lounge but this is not the same. Also, the breakfast was tasty but a bit limited - just a buffet with no a la carte or egg chef.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and top in class”
Reviews.Author: John_FMontreal
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at Le Germain on Mercer street for years, Every time I am in Toronto. Always top of class! Feels like being home, great location, service, rooms, breakfast, setting and consistent !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but the location could be better!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and I always had a great stay. The rooms were wonderful and the staff were also very professional. The location could be better and the breakfast has got to improve--serve some hot breakfast please!!! If you're here for business, this is a good hotel. But if you're here for fun, stay in Yorkville. Check out the hazelton hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good - some minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: Kanuckian
Reviews.Content: I live just north of Toronto so staying downtown is not a regular occurrence for me. I stayed here on Saturday night on the recommendation of a friend. The hotel is built in an old warehouse - this means very high ceilings and lots of space. The service upon arriving was fine - the young men greeting us at the door and valet were very polite and helpful. The check- in ladies were also very polite. We had a suite on the 7th floor which we reserved through the hotel website. The room was very spacious - much larger than what you'd expect at a hotel in Europe. We thought the way it was laid out was very clever - however I would change a couple things. #1 - the lighting in the master bathroom is terrible - it is dark. #2 - the shower doesn't have a door (which is fine and quite nice) but the poor design means water leaks out all over the floor. #3 - this suite is positioned directly across from the elevator which makes it noisy at times. #4 - the suite faces south east (which means bright sunshine in the morning which is lovely) however there is a nightclub right below which we could hear until 2am. Breakfast was "included" and was served "continental" style - cereals, toast, juice, smoked salmon, bagels etc - it was OK, but I thought the lay-out was not good. All in all I don't think I would pick that room for that rate again, but the hotel didn't have any major flaws. For around $700/night it was average - I think for that much it should be outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: RH_Travellors
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a business meeing for a few days. It is a boutique hotel right in the heart of the entertainment district. The rooms are quite spacious and clean. The beds were ver comfortable and rooms quiet. Nice change for a downtown hotel. I was also impressed with the service of the staff. Only minor concern is that the meeting rooms are not really condusive to group discussions. They make for a good board table but not well lit for leading discussions with charts and graphs on the walls.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jeffkov
Reviews.Content: The attention to detail, facilities, staff, service, attitude are all wonderful. The beds , linens, towels are are first rate. I love the free cappuccino in the lobby, the many newspapers, the crackling fire in the lobby living room in the winter - I could go on, but there are lts of steel reviews (with good reason).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: celticgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend a couple of the reception staff at this hotel highly enough, Charlene & Jeanna. I stayed there for a week with a number of colleagues during a conference and when I had trouble with severely delayed flights, they went out of their way to help sort everything out and turn a nightmare into good day. The hotel itself is stylish, the food and service good but Charlene and Jeanna's attitude and friendly assistance is what made it really stand out & put it well above most other hotels I've stayed in and I travel a lot. The only one thing I could find that could be improved (and this was maybe just me being really picky) is that they could do with adding a master light switch by the beds to turn off the main lights rather than just the one by the door.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, contemporary and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Architectandmusician
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel in Toronto. I have stayed here many times, and have never been disappointed. The service has been uniformly excellent. The interior design is sophisticated, contemporary and elegant in an understated way. The breakfast room is particularly attractive. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I wish my family was as elegant and hospitable...”
Reviews.Author: akoba
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a night at the Hotel Le Germain in downtown Toronto and enjoyed some much needed adult time at this gorgeous hotel. We were immediately impressed with the understated elegance of the hotel and the quiet and friendly staff. Our room also did not disappoint. The decor was much to our personal tastes and we loved the different tiles and impressive fixtures in the bathroom. My only complaint about the room would be that the heavy sliding "door" for the toilet enclosure was fairly hard to move owing to its sheer size. And my one caveat would be that with the shower/bath having a glass wall on the side facing the room means that you might unintentionally flash your travel mate (the blind is on the outside of the glass for obvious reasons) and while this may be fun for a couple, could be "less fun" for others! While there was some confusion as to our type of booking, the front desk was quick to sort out the problem. We did get some inconsistent information from the front desk as to what time the breakfast was put away, it being for Sunday morning, but they figured it out eventually. We also opted for a late check out time, which gave us an extra hour, but I was impressed that the regular check out time was 12 o'clock. Having arrived too late for dinner before our outing we quickly ordered some room service from the Hotel's restaurant Victor. My husband had some oxtail soup and I just needed some french fries to tide me over...they arrived promptly and were quite delicious. We were disappointed that we wouldn't be able to sample from the menu later when we returned to the hotel as the room service late at night only offers cold foods...fortunately that part of Toronto has plenty of eateries still serving after the midnight hour on a Saturday. Some people have reviewed that the hotel was very noisy on weekend nights due to the clubs across the street, and perhaps they were right? I couldn't say...we were lucky to be on the side of the hotel facing King, and were fairly high up. I was surprised when we arrived on Mercer...aside from The Second City and Wayne Gretzky's further down the street it seemed rather empty...when we came back to the hotel late at night the buildings on Mercer that looked like warehouses were in fact clubs with snaking line ups going down the street...however walking into the hotel (guarded by a friendly doorman) was like walking into a quiet oasis. Our room was also situated next to the elevator (gasp!) but we didn't have a problem with noise at all...no foot traffic noise and no elevator machinery noise! A nice change that shows the quality of material the hotel is built with. The breakfast buffet the next morning was very nice...a definite step up from your typical hotel breakfast layout: real homemade oatmeal, a choice of artisinal jams, real espresso machines were the highlights I remember offhand. Oh and if you get a chance you have to try the automatic coffee machine in the lobby library...not only does it make a million drinks, it can babysit your kids and do your taxes. The Groupe Germain certainly knows a thing or two about hospitality and about the importance of details. I would certainly return to this hotel and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels.”
Reviews.Author: travelchick05
Reviews.Content: Definitely upscale and a little more expensive but well worth the few extra dollars. I love the rooms and the general decor of the hotel. Hotel staff was excellent, I've stayed there twice and it was excellent both times.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Eclectic and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: luluatoll
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why their website is so terrible in terms of selling you on staying at the property. The hotel is located on an alley - which can seem odd perhaps at night, but for its totally fine and a quite walk to the ultra-hip Queen West shopping area. The hotel lobby is spacious and warm modern designed. The rooms are really nice, modern, great for business trip or couples weekend away - not great for families. The prices are pretty reasonable and I ordered rom service and the meal was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime and Chic Hotel - an exquisite experience”
Reviews.Author: LinnieMaple
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything to dislike about Le Germain. The rooms are spacious, the beds and especially the linens are heavenly, the in room entertainment (Bose) is great, the bathrooms are luxurious with large walk-in showers. Perhaps the price is the only slightly painful part! Views are nothing to get excited about, so there not much to choose from a front or back facing room. From a location perspective the hotel is in the entertainment district which is great if you're a tourist, but let's be honest, although Toronto is a city, its not huge and so everywhere is accessible.

Reviews.Title: “You can't stay at a better hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynshaz
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto at least every month and Hotel Le Germain is where I stay. It's slightly more expensive but the hotel is well worth the money. The room is set up with free wi-fi and you get a wonderful breakfast every morning. I can't say enough great things about the hotel. The staff is always amazingly helpful and polite. Even after a hectic day of work I walk into the hotel room and I feel instantly relaxed. The beds are extremely comfortable and the shower....there are no words to describe the shower! It's like standing under a waterfall! Stay at the hotel - it's the best thing you can do for yourself. And the location is very central - especially if you are seeing a show.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Beautiful beds and great atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: missie22
Reviews.Content: A really lovely downtown hotelbwith great rooms. A really fluffy big bed..very enticing after a long journey...just wanted to crawl into it...when i did, it was super comfy too. Great facilities in the room, big desk, ipod dock and speakers and a lovely rain shower. One of the best features was the rooftop smoking terrace at night. I dont smoke but it is the perfect spot for a nightime city view...and with nobody smokin on it..it was amazing. Definately reccomend this hotel. Good liitle gym too with a quirky outdoor roof top putting green of all things.

Reviews.Title: “What a room!”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I only spent one night at this property. I would have loved to have spent more time in here. (As such, I can only speak about the room, as the rest of the hotel went largely unexplored.) The room is large, with high ceilings and lots of storage. And while there is a nightclub across the street from the room in which I stayed, I didn't hear it whatsoever, so the windows must be decent quality. The bathroom with the glass-walled shower facing the bed is really cool, luxurious and modern. My one complaint is the bed frame, upon which I smashed my leg several times while walking around the bed to get to and from the work desk.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Bic20
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at le Germain and we certainly weren't disappointed. If you are sick of standard hotel rooms and are interested in style and design you'll love this hotel. The staff is young and helpful and the breakfast bar contains fresh and healthy selections. This will be our hotel of choice any time we are in Toronto and we are anxious to try their hotels in Montreal and Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “Secret Paradise in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: luv2beafoodie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived in Toronto for our 5 day vacation, never having been there before, we were excited to begin our journey. We were excited partly because we had already had assistance from the Concierge at the hotel, who was able to get us the perfect reservation time at Canoe Restaurant. When calling on our own, they only offered late night openings and when we explained this to the Concierge, she had the reservation made and sent to us via email within 2 hours! Each and every time we called with questions prior to our trip, they were more than helpful, and always went the extra mile! We knew at that point that we had chosen the right hotel. From the moment our car dropped us at the door of Le Germain on Mercer Street, the stay was fantastic, and on a scale of 1-10, it is a perfect 20! The hotel is tucked away on a small side street with minimal traffic, but close in proximity to everything a tourist wants to see when visiting Toronto. The staff greeted us with a huge smile and welcome at 9:00 am, when we arrived, which was very early considering rooms are not normally available until afternoon. Not this time...... our room was ready and waiting. We were given our room keys and all the information we would need to know. Our questions were answered, and then some! If we didn't know where to connect with transportation or wanted more information about a tourist attraction, they went out of their way to provide us with whatever we needed, such as, telling us the streetcar and trains only take exact change, and they offered to make change for us. The staff always made sure we were all set with maps and anything else prior to venturing out of the hotel on tours, or sightseeing. They have a wonderful library area where you can relax and have a cup of coffee from their Espresso/Coffee/Hot Chocolate Machine. All the staples needed for your coffee were always well stocked. The first day we arrived, we just wanted to see the library and walked up the stairs to the area. The coffee machine had an "out of order" sign placed on it, not that we wanted a cup at that moment, however we did stop at the desk to let them know. The staff responded right away with "we are so sorry and we will have someone come and repair it right now". We were taken aback by the prompt response and desire to please their customers! By the way, when we got back later that day, the machine was repaired! Out of all of the hotels we have been to, I would have to say this one has employed the most customer pleasing staff I have seen thus far. They really NEVER said no, or I don't know. The rooms were beautiful, clean, and so unique. The bed was like a piece of heaven! The housekeeping staff were also wonderful, very friendly, and always willing to please. We asked for bottles of water and each day they were left in our room, we never had to ask again. You were made to feel like you were the only guests staying at the hotel. I know the hotel was very busy that week-end because there was a wedding party staying there, but if we had not been told that, we would have never known. You are treated like royalty. If we have the chance to visit Toronto again, we would choose Le Germain and would definitely recommend it to anyone who asks. Thank you to the whole staff of Le Germain for making our first stay in Toronto a wonderful memory!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SKA_10
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews but was disappointed with the quality of our room. The furniture was gouged and stained and the ceiling was in very poor condition. The room was very quiet which was nice but overlooked an alley filled with garbage. The hotel staff was great and the room was very clean. I thought it was overpriced and overrated as well.

Reviews.Title: “Funky in a fine location”
Reviews.Author: Veggiemel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for international visitors, as it is an easy walk from the Hyatt Regency Airport Express stop. It is close to Wayne Gretsky's bar and within easy access of some major attractions (CN Tower; Rogers Centre; Steam Brewery) as well as a number of theatres, and there's a good range of restaurants - for breakfast and dinner - close by. Although on first look it may not be too prepossessing, as it is adjacent to an empty lot used for parking and opposite a night club with roof terrace, inside it is cool and contemporary ( a look that is reflected in the bar, which looks very glamorous at night) and surprisingly peaceful. Importantly, as we stayed here our first two nights in the country, following a midday flight form teh UK, our superior double room (and especially the bed) was very comfortable and plenty big enough. It featured a good sized and powerful shower (the Aveda toiletries are a nice touch, alongside good quality towels and bathrobe) and although the bathroom's glass wall initially felt a bit 'exposed', the floor to ceiling blind coordianted with the blind at the window and gave sufficient privacy while allowing natural light into the bathroom. A high quality Ipod dock and tv added to the feeling of urban chic. The staff were very friendly and efficient - we needed our bedding changed on arrival, and housekeeping responded incredibly quickly. At Â£160 a night, room only, it wasn't cheap, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Easily outshines the bigger conference hotels. Would return in a heartbeat!!”
Reviews.Author: LucieF68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this small boutique hotel for a conference at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre. A previous very positive experience at Le Germain in Montreal led me to book this hotel. It is a mere 5 min walk to the Convention Centre, so very convenient. The room was beautiful and well appointed. The daily breakfast that was included was a lovely spread of a wide variety of items, delicious and plentiful! The service (check-in, breakfast, phone, room service) was consistently great. I phoned the reception on the second day to ask that the bathroom fan be looked at (because it had a faint but constant rattle to it and there was no switch to turn it off). It was quickly looked at by maintenance and couldn't be readily fixed so I was offered another room (an upgraded one) with apologies for the inconvenience. I hadn't made a big fuss about this either, because it was just mildly irritating. Of note, most of my colleagues stayed at the Royal York and Intercontinental (the 2 hotels recommended by our conference organizers). There was a huge Bollywood festival going on and they reported total chaos. Upon checkin at 4pm, some of their rooms weren't ready until after 10pm! There was excessive noise in and just outside these hotels until past 2:30 am a few nights in a row, so many of them were very sleep-deprived. Their hotels offered little in terms of apology or compensation. I felt very lucky in my lesser known, luxurious oasis just a few blocks away....

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: nassaulovers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Le Germain three or four times. It's the best kept secret in Toronto! Beautifully decorated boutique hotel with the most comfortable beds. It's the small things that make this hotel so great. When we arrive the concierge and front desk staff welcome us back, before we show any id! So they remember or somehow know we have stayed with them before. We are checked in super fast, grab an apple, there are apples displayed everywhere. Then as we open the door to our room, the sound of Bose music comes on (activated by opening the door). If you need tickets to anything, club, concert, musical. The concierge can usually help! I'll mention that we also own our own condo in Toronto and we still choose to stay at Le Germain when we want to get away and pretend to be visitors in our own town. Almost forgot, an amazing healthy breakfast is included with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, beautiful people, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: crewtips
Reviews.Content: I regret the fact that I was only able to stay for one night as I had to return to Miami on the 30th. We arrived in our tiny trendy Fiat 500 and this handsome lad out of a GQ magazine took our luggage and valet parked the "toy car" . At the front desk a slender, beautiful girl welcomed us with her french accent... everyone around seems to have an accent. She was very professional and informative. The room was what I expected, trendy, contemporary beautiful and comfortable. The hotel is a gem if anything a bit pretentious...I guess not as pretentious as we are though so we loved it. HAA!! We had dinner downstairs at Victor. I had an outstanding veal chop and a couple glasses of Malbec. Perfection. Dessert was some sort of mojito custard . Very good. Continental breakfast in bed, delicious croissants and pastries , fresh fruit, yoghurt , coffe fresh squeezed orange juice. We absolutely LOVED Le Germain, I would stay there whenever I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @Le Germain, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: metzger_mb
Reviews.Content: Excellent on all the line. Services first (what in fact make you write), comfort, small attentions, extra clean, super shower, excellent bed. Everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service,”
Reviews.Author: Learned_TravelParent
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a business trip. The staff was excellent and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The hotel is a little difficult to find as it is not on a main street, but, it is still located well enough to be convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern hotel...”
Reviews.Author: EatWithMe007
Reviews.Content: Awesome shower. Try the $100,000 espresso machine in the lobby. The only thing it doesn't do is press your shirt...unbelievable...Hopping bar scene...

Reviews.Title: “Quite, comfortable, slightly funky hotel with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: davidn59
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 7pm and staff were initially doubtful about arranging a tour to Niagara Falls the next morning but then rang to say it was all done. Obviously there was a problem because the bus did not turn up next morning. However, Andrew on the desk went to considerable trouble complaining on my behalf and finding another tour that afternoon with a special price and options to compensate. Like all modern hotels, there are lots of lights in the room but none that actually illuminate anything. There is no dvd player in the room, not unusual and not a problem, but the web site says there was one. The buffet breakfast lacked something in variety, but there is still plenty to fill you up. They could not give me a late checkout, at least not past 1:00pm, and I had a late flight, but they were very happy for me go to the gym after checkout and then have a shower there. I was offered earplugs in case of external noise but my room was very quiet, perhaps because it was away from the front street of the hotel. Not sure if the air conditioning worked in the room. This was not a problem given the time of the year but its operation was definitely beyond my intelligence.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: We reserved at the Germain based on the review of Tripadvisor. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel has been oped in 2003 but still look decent. Ground floor with lounge is pretty unique. Food at the restaurant was very good, although the staff of the restaurant was obviously not used to see family with young kids. Room service was slow. All in all a great hotel, the location is not the most common and although the service is ok, don't expect the service a professional hotel of this category.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Content: It was my 2nd time at the Germain Toronto It is perfect: great service, good breakfast and very comfortable bed (I want to buy the pillow!) That is now the hotel where I want to stay everytime I have to go to Toronto (just as I go to the Germain-Dominion everytime I go in Quebec City)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: regular_traveler05
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with their relaxation package. Room was was fantastic and larger than expected; interior design of both the room and lobby area was well thought out. The concierge service was very helpful in finding different things in the city and setting up services. The masseuses that are on-call are excellent and very personable. Also had breakfast service each morning, which had a large variety of options. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What great interior design.”
Reviews.Author: emberbor
Reviews.Content: From the friendliest consierges to the all-day coffee/tea service in the library, this is THE place to stay while in Toronto. The bathroom is amazing. The best we have ever had after traveling the whole world. If you like going to the theater or the comedy clubs, you will be a ten minute walk away. Free newspapers, a friendly fireplace, cozy rooms with sumptuous bathrobes, this is one of the ones we will definitely re-visit. The restaurant Victor on the first floor is also excellent, quiet, and healthy. Of a two week trip, this was our favorite part. It was difficult to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious comfort”
Reviews.Author: chgofilmfan
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. I got sick my first night there and part of next day (reaction to flu shot maybe?) and I STILL enjoyed my stay. I was lying in my oh, so comfortable king size bed, aching and queasy and thinking "this is nice!" Very modern but warm lobby and room. Bose Wave radio, free Wifi, coffee in lobby. It was very centrally located. I flew into the City Island airport and was less than a $10 cab ride away. I could walk to the theater. I walked back to the hotel after the Raptors/Celtics game. Great, friendly staff. I could hear typical, city noises thru the window from 7th floor but not enough to disturb me when sleeping. However, my room faced Wellington. The other side (front) of the hotel is directly across the street from what looks like two very popular night clubs and Second City Toronto. Probably much noisier. Keep in mind if taking taxi back to hotel in evening. Very congested. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!! Would go back in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: Puddlejumping
Reviews.Content: Le Germain is an amazing hotel. It has a warm cozy trendy feel but is plush and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and made sure our stay was memorable. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone going to Toronto. The rooms are large and the hotel is definatly worth money. Furthermore the location is perfect and central with easy access to the king streetcar and walking distance to good shows and restaurants, the CN tower, the ferries to the Island, and queen st. The beds are incredibly comfortable with very high quality linens. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. All in all, a great experience and one I hope to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: krayZpaving
Reviews.Content: Le Germain is a wonderful hotel - chic, hip and very urban. Others have said it all before me. The three things I didn't like: 1) The doormen's uniform is such that it's difficult to tell if they're taxidrivers waiting for a fare or people who work for the hotel. The brown leather jackets are nice, but tough to tell at first glance that they're staff. 2) The window blinds are venetian style, so don't shut out light entirely. That's okay in the winter, but I guess the room wouldn't stay dark long into the morning in the summer. 3) The windows are far from noiseproof. I could hear conversation from a nearby bar and cars driving past. Fortunately, the hotel is on a relatively quiet street, so not a huge problem, but one you would think they'd have addressed in initial design. Overall, a great hotel. I'm only pointing out a few flaws because all the other reviews were so great!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in the city”
Reviews.Author: traveltdot
Reviews.Content: stay November 2003 Years have passed since our wedding night but i thought I would write a review about Le Germain. We were married in Toronto and were going to honeymoon in Hawaii months later. But we decided to stay at a hotel on our wedding night. We choose Le Germain Toronto after staying at Le Germain in Montreal. I knew they wouldn't disappoint us. We stayed in a regular room because we still were on a budget from all of our wedding costs and the staff took great care of us. Maybe because we showed up in wedding dress and suit that gave it all away but everyone seemed to give us great service and attention. The hotel was fairly new and did not have their restaurant running at the time but we ordered in some food and they promptly brought it up to our room without any questions. Usually they don't allow deliveries to the room. But was glad they made the exception. The bed was amazing and comfortable, beautiful white crisp bedsheets, furniture modern and sleek. The bathroom was very modern with a glass wall separating the two rooms. I know other boutique hotels do this now but at the time this was the first hotel Toronto had seen this!! It was very hip at the time. The only downfall to the room was that it was overlooking the alley mess. I think they have now frosted the glasses 7 years later but i do remember thinking that it was a bit ugly to see. In the morning a lovely continental breakfast with great lattes and papers were included in the stay. We had a lovely stay here and would recommend to anyone looking for a quiet and romantic getaway in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique bliss in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: frozen.north
Reviews.Content: Le Germain is the epitome of urban chic. Cool jazz from the Bose stereo greeted me as I walked in the door of my room, decked out in dark wood and white linens. A picture window, with shutters for privacy, connects the room to the ensuite, where a stainless steel sink floats in a glass countertop. Iâ€™m also a fan of the Aveda products and the lighted makeup mirror, and the earplugs to drown out the downtown Toronto traffic are a thoughtful touch. A great choice in a very central downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Hotel Le Germain”
Reviews.Author: KerryWho?
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in late September. We were very pleased with the hotel. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. The restaurant was comfortable with good food and service. Some additional pointers: the location is on the west side of Toronto, meaning that it is in the entertainment district. The area is okay but not as nice as spots on the east side of town. A few additonal facts about Toronto generally: friendly and helpful locals. Taxes and cab fare are high here and good restaurants can be quite expensive. The hotel rate was not cheap but worth the price. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit into town.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: mols0n
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed the modern design and appeal for our quick get-away. Great location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “nice touches”
Reviews.Author: grumpel7
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately hotels in Toronto are costly. So although this hotel had a great ambiance and wonderful rooms, we ended up spending close to $300 for one night's stay (we live close to the city and stayed here for a concert) despite the fact that this was a prepaid, non-refundable deal - valet parking and breakfast in the morning alone accounted for 1/4 of the bill. Service was ok, breakfast and room service food not worth the price. I will stay here again but eat out instead.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: Its taken a few months to write this review but the memories of staying at this hotel remain everlasting. We spent 5 days in this hotel and from the minute we walked through the door to checking out everything was fantastic. We had arranged to be married in Toronto and the stay here at Le Germain made our day even more special. The rooms were very stylishly decorated, the beds were extremely comfortable, the bathroom was very modern with great amenities. Even though our room faced the night club noise wasn't an issue and the hotel even provided ear plugs for those more sensitive to sound. Service at this hotel was second to none, the staff were friendly, efficient and always willing to help to ensure we had a comfortable stay and a great time in Toronto. The attention to detail sets this hotel apart from others. Everyone from front of house, restrauant staff to housekeeping excelled. The fitness centre was on the small side but adequate. The location of the hotel is a bit off central but everything is still within walking distance. Breakfast however could be improved with more choices being made available, although what is offered is of high quality. Even a mistake on our bill noticed after we had checked out was rectified within 2 days, very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Toronto"s finest”
Reviews.Author: Jonesilla
Reviews.Content: Staff and service exceeded expectations. A great stay. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: NEresident
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Le Germain to celebrate my husband's birthday. The room was spacious, extremely clean, modern, and tastefully decorated. Overall, I was quite impressed with the service and attentiveness of the hotel staff. The concierge was very helpful in arranging a sitter for our toddler so my husband and I could enjoy a night out. I also had asked her to purchase a birthday cake for my husband. She picked out a delicious cake and had it waiting in our room at check-in, with a bottle of wine and a personal note wishing us a nice weekend. The housekeeping staff also set up a diaper pail in our room (without us having to ask), which I really appreciated. The hotel was super quiet (we were on the 10th floor) -- never heard a peep from anyone. Yes, the hotel is on a side street, but in my opinion that was an asset -- quieter, easier to get in and out of, etc. We were very pleased with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, all the ingredients but lacking in atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AmyEmily
Reviews.Content: The title sums it up, really. The service was good but very distant, not at all friendly. We don't like big hotels and try to go for the smaller, boutique hotels. I guess this hotel is ideal for businessmen but as tourists we wanted something with a bit more atmosphere. Sadly, we didn't find it here, although there was nothing specific to criticise.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at Le Germain and were not disappointed. The rooms are very spacious with tall ceilings and all the modern comforts including a great bed. Staff were very friendly. No qualms at all? Well, it's a ten minute hike to the subway station. That's fine for one or two days, after that it becomes a little boring.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: The_Cart_Toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on an awful, sketchy looking street with absolutely no view on either side of the building. It is conveniently located for tourists, however, so are countless other hotels that are located in the downtown core. I would classify this as a 3 star hotel. Room was not ready at 4pm even though check-in was 3pm. Zero amenities. Hotel had no vibe, no lobby lounge other than a library sitting area with an honor bar serving 3 mediocre varietals of wine. Comfortable bed and shower but again nothing that would differentiate it from most other hotels. No turndown service. Lengthy line-up for check out. We live in Toronto and spent the night here for our anniversary. I would not recommend it to visitors. There are much nicer hotels that will not require you to spend $400.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Luxurious, Chic and Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveBug1013
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got out of our taxi, the service was top notch! The bellmen were very friendly and willing to help you with directions, getting a taxi, or even an umbrella. The front desk persons were very welcoming and wanted my stay to be the best. I made a bit of a stink to my co-workers about being placed on the 3rd floor and the gentlemen working at the front desk overheard my issue with the noise level on the lower floor and changed my room immediately to the 10th floor. The room was immaculate! It was very large and had a nice comfy bed. The bathroom was amazing, I loved the rain shower! I meet with my co-workers each morning for their breakfast, which was very enjoyable. The food was a lovely variety of pasteries, fruits, oatmeal and the staff would make you any coffee or tea you wanted. They were very friendly and willing to make sure you had a wonderful breakfast. I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are traveling to Toronto. It is quite lovely, very clean, and the friendliest staff working here to make your stay enjoyable. If I ever return to Toronto, I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent refuge and a stylish comfortable stay; highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: voyager_b
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end my stay here was wholy enjoyable. The rooms are very stylish and the King bed and pillows a treat to sleep in. Room Service was prompt and served with a smile. The room was large and with a splendid bathroom. A work station was provided and the internet access, both wireles & ethernet is free. There's a splendid coffee machine in the lobby positioned in an area set aside with sofas and a small and interesting library. I didn't eat in the restaurant but Roo Service is from the same kitchen. Bravo, 10/10 all round. There is even a Kindle to borrow!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the germain, and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: gingermrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Germain for the first 3 nights of trip to Ontario for a wedding and sightseeing etc. None of the other hotels we stayed in after could compare! Hotel was down a smaller street but close enough to main attractions and transport etc We arrived in a taxi and straight away there was a member of staff opening the door to welcome us. we were checked in by a guy called George who was very friendly and we were instant offered water out of their fridge. Our room was perfect. clean, roomy, great AC lovely and quiet. We loved having a desk and a great relaxer chair. The shower is the BEST ive ever tried.never wanted to get out! The bed was SO comfy.We had told them it was our wedding anniversary and on arrival we had a place of little cakes/cookies to wish us happy anniversary, that was a really nice touch. we felt so relaxed staying there and enjoyed the roof garden and the amazing library/seating area downstairs. its so nice to be able to make a nice coffee/hot chocolate before setting off for the day, and a free bottle of water from the lobby on the way out. All great touches which makes this hotel work so well. On check out we were asked how our stay was (which we came to appreciate as we weren't asked in all the hotels we stayed in) a nice guy (with a beard!) asked if there was anything else they could do for us and it just ended the experience as great as it started. Honestly, we could have stayed much longer....no complaints at all and will def stay again when we're back in Toronto im sure they shower and bed helped me get over jet lag quicker! In short, great rooms, AMAZING shower and bed, friendly and helpful staff, great library and coffee machine!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotels around, the Le Germain is a beautiful boutique hotel that caters to those traveling for business and pleasure. Unlike the large chain hotels, this one does not charge for internet access and provides complimentary breakfast that includes hot oatmeal and fresh fruit. It's refreshing to find a hotel that doesn't seem to nickel and dime you... it even provides a complimentary car service in the morning for those who need to get to their office or the shopping centre. Bottled water is available throughout. The rooms are comfortable, spacious and clean. King beds are comfortable and provide a great night's sleep. The bathroom has a great rain shower that makes you want to stay here and not leave. Regarding the amenities, the gym is small but sufficient with two treadmills, an elliptical, some free weights and a pull-down machine. The library is great for team meetings and getting your caffeine fix whenver you want. Victor, the restaurant, offers great food and wine without the 5-star hotel prices. However, nothing beats the hotel staff. I've stayed in plenty of 5-star properties and this one rivals the Ritz Carlton in terms of service. The front desk staff and the bellhops are attentive and polite. They are ready to help and gracious in every way possible. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Six Years later - This Great Hotel is still our FIrst Choice.”
Reviews.Author: Northerngirl1
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from another four night stay at Le Germain â€“ our hotel of choice in Toronto -- and I thought it was time to post a follow-up review. We first stayed at Hotel Le Germain in July of 2004 and when I look back at our review six years ago I notice that most, if not all, of it would be applicable. The staff continues to be terrific â€“ helpful, gracious, and responsive at all times. Minor issues have always been resolved instantly and with class. (This last trip a glitch in our Tablet â€œperkâ€� of a $20 certificate at Victorâ€™s was overlooked â€“ through no fault of the hotel. The front desk staff quickly solved the oversight and offered complimentary drinks.) The small touches in the rooms and public areas such as the self serve top-notch espresso machine, the honour bar in the afternoon, bath robes, umbrellas, welcome back notes (and sometimes cookies) in our rooms â€“ are all wonderful little touches that make our stay relaxing and enjoyable. There has been sufficient upgrading and refurbishment through the years throughout the hotel. We always enjoy the continental breakfast in the mezzanine room every morning. One thing that has not changed is the heavenly and oh-so-soothing rainforest walk in shower that Le Germain is well known for. The restaurant has gone through changes through the years. Weâ€™ve not eaten there recently, but have frequented the small bar at Victorâ€™s a number of times. There has been a friendly, attentive and wonderful young man bartending most times weâ€™ve dropped by in the evening. The bar menu/appetizers are great and the selection of wines by the glass and cocktails are good. The loud and noisy club across the street on week-end nights does indeed strike you as a noticeable contrast to the smart upscale boutique hotel you are staying in and yes it has occasionally been noisy, but even facing the club, on the lower floors, weâ€™ve never found it to be that bad. Location is also great. Weâ€™d still highly recommend Hotel Le Germain in downtown Toronto. Weâ€™re booked again for a night in May as we travel through Toronto! Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Professional service, nicely appointed.”
Reviews.Author: Hopefullylost
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Germain for Valentine's with my fiance. The rooms are very nicely appointed with great linen's and a wonderful bathtub. Only sore note was that the very unique faucet in the tub that didn't work; the water ranged from super hot to burn your skin off. Ended up having to bail cold water from the sink into the tub to make it bearable. Upon informing the staff they were very apologetic and took the charge for the valet parking off our bill to compensate us for the inconvenience. Inconveniences happen and they handled it very well so no sour grapes at all. Room service was excellent and very quick. I would definitely return and recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully CLASSY Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: warmst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for a romantic night away. The hotel was impeccably clean, the hotel staff were friendly, attentive and yet not intrusive. The lobby has a real wood burning fire place with lots of cozy chairs/couches to relax on. A self serve cappuccino machine that also makes hot chocolate/cafe mocha etc is also in the lobby/lounge and it was actually great coffee! I would describe the style of the hotel as "Urban Sheik". Not over done, classy. We stayed in the "basic" room type but there really didn't feel like there was anything basic about it. Very well decorated, beautiful furniture, bose stereo system, great lighting. Bathroom was very sexy - the wall separating the shower from the bedroom was entirely made from clear glass! You did have the option of closing the blinds on the glass wall if you wanted privacy though. They have a wonderful turn down service - replaced all the used towels, any used glassware, and left chocolates on the pillows - very nice. Our room came with a continental breakfast and it was probably the best we've ever had at a hotel. Everything was hot, and fresh. The menu included warm quiche, roasted potatos, smoked salmon with capers, fresh croissants, 5 different kinds of organic granola, yogurt, fresh fruit, eggs and freshly squeezed juices. The location of the buffet style breakfast was VERY clean and the staff were VERY attentive - getting us coffee, clearing the dirty dishes etc. We didn't use the fitness facilities, but we did check out the room - very well equipped with several machines located on the top floor. Lots of glass and sunshine - nice to have the natural light. All the treadmills had their own TVs with headphones. They also have an outdoor putting green on the roof for the warmer months. This was probably the best hotel I've stayed at in the Toronto area. A a small boutique hotel (114 rooms) that offers exceptional service. I will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's the best place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TrishD3
Reviews.Content: Imagine a boutique hotel where breakfast, wireless, apples and water are free (well included in your room rate) no extra charges. And there is a great wine bar and library to hang out in.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Stitcher12396
Reviews.Content: Service was great and the staff very accommodating Location is within walking distance to lots of sites & also close to public transit Very enjoyable atmosphere - especially the fireplace! Cuisine in the restaurant & also the breakfast room - very enjoyable Will definitely stay at HÃ´tel Le Germain again. Looking forward to it!! Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A slightly flawed Toronto favourite”
Reviews.Author: tasmanian-wolf
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit Toronto, this is the place we always choose to stay. After spending a busy day in the city, when you're feeling tired and footsore, it's an absolute joy to walk into the Germain's fabulous, spacious, air-conditioned, luxurious and very stylish rooms. Even better is a blissful soak in the deep bath or drenching yourself underneath the tropical rainforest-style showerhead. The location is excellent - far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the busy shopping/touristy areas, but close enough to many of Toronto's attractions - including the comedy club, Second City, just across the road. You're also not too far away from both trolley bus stops and the subway. Inside the smart lobby, the staff have always been very courteous and helpful to us. If you have a car, there is valet parking. Up a few stairs is a mezzanine area with a library of art books, free coffee, newspapers and a computer with broadband internet access (very handy if you need to check-in online for your flight home.) Unfortunately, this computer access does tend to be monopolised somewhat if a convention is taking place within the hotel. We also found that the restaurant, Chez Victor, can also be closed occasionally in order to provide conference facilities, which was slightly disappointing on our latest visit. The breakfast doesn't rate as 5 star quality, I'd say, but is a nice enough Continental buffet-style affair. Staff are charming and attentive, making sure that the food is well-stocked and topping you up with tea or coffee. One word of warning: on weekends there is an horrendously noisy club operating into the small hours of the morning with extremely loud music. Such a shame as it spoils the enjoyment of an otherwise very relaxing and comfortable hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will not be returning - a "one-star" hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockyToronto
Reviews.Content: Went to stay there for a celebratory weekend. Wanted a patio as it was springtime and hoped to enjoy the beautiful weather. The patio was filthy and the doors were covered in spiderwebs. Ordered room service. When the second order of room service came we asked for the first set of plates to be removed but the staff said that they don't do that. In the morning our table was covered in dirty dishes - and when the breakfast room service came they still did not remove it! Did not like the restaurant Victor at all - steak came raw -sent back to cook to medium but they brought out a burnt well done steak. I could go on but it just gets worse. Staff at hotel did not seem to care about customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it for the location”
Reviews.Author: notacouchpotato
Reviews.Content: We had three nights in this boutique style hotel where the room (we had a deluxe one) was much larger than average. The bathroom was superb - walk in shower and lots of lovely Aveda products. The bed was extremely comfortable and I noticed there was a choice of pillows though we stuck with those we were given. Staff were pleasant but didn't always have facts at their finger tips (particularly not the concierge who seemed more interested in her manicure than in us). Great location within walking distance to the harboure, CN Tower, shops and theatre. Opposite a club which might have been a problem but not whilst we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect room”
Reviews.Author: PepeGoteras
Reviews.Content: I've in the Hotel for four days. Great hotel. Very nice and attractive design of all furniture and decoration. The room was small, but great. Strange they didn't change the towels everyday and they didn't give us new shampoo, but the place it's very good. A place to go. My next time in Toronto I will repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel -- noisy club across the road...”
Reviews.Author: travelcda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Germain for our 10th wedding anniversary. Upon check in we were very pleased with our room. While not overly spacious, it was just enough for us and the bathroom was fantastic -- oversized with a separate water closet for the toilet. The walk in shower with rain-shower head was to die for. The king sized bed was lovely. Our room faced South and thus we had a rude awakening around 1.00am on the Saturday morning. The pounding bass and street noise from the popular club across the street was absolutely intolerable. It was only in the morning when we discovered the discretely placed ear plugs in the bed stand...the disruption lasted for almost 2 hours. But thankfully we were able to sleep in and enjoy the serene dining area and vast complimentary breakfast offered by the Germain. Well attended staff kept beverages flowing and the food was excellent. All in all an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Once a year!”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here on our wedding anniversary every year... need I say more :) The room, the atmosphere, the staff are all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: norlana
Reviews.Content: When I arrive in my room at the Germain, I immediately let out a huge ahhhh! The bed is fantastic, the food at Victor is unsurpassed (tonight I had Tuna Confit) and they always have great jazz playing upon arrive in the room. It is a welcome retreat after travelling. Impecable service from all the staff. Complete and ultimate care!

Reviews.Title: “best location for theatre”
Reviews.Author: go2trees
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Le Germain and found the staff helpful and pleasant. The hotel has a contemporary look, i.e. the seating in the lobby was more design than comfort. Our room had a glass wall for the washroom/shower which allowed much needed light; the toiletries were Aveda and the king size bed cosy with a thick douvet. A substantial "continental" breakfast was a very nice addition (boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, toast, fresh fruit, caps & espresso.) Being our first time in Toronto, we did not know the lay of the land. This hotel is perfect to be near the theatre district, it is actually located just across the street from Second City and down the block from Wayne Gretzky's restaurant. Also, within a few blocks is a grocery store, a drug store and two ok Italian restaurants. For seeing museums & shopping at the Eaton Centre, a hotel along Bloor Ave. would have been a better choice for us. I would recommend this hotel, but for $C255/night we spent too much additional money taking taxis to where we really wanted to be which was to the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, not great for business”
Reviews.Author: rorokimtor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Germain for a week in November this year. We were primarily there for a business trip, but also held a birthday party for my wife Le Germain's Apartment Suite. The Apartment Suite was the perfect place to hold a small party (12 people) and we loved that Le Germain didn't give us any trouble when we brought in our own food and liquor for our get-together. The staff was very helpful in getting things set up and making sure we had enough dishes in the kitchen, etc. We had a fabulous night and would definitely book there again for that kind of event. For the rest of our stay, we had a standard room with a king bed. The room itself was very spacious and beautifully decorated - it felt very luxurious. It was also very quiet. There were plenty of closets and drawers, even in the bathroom, which is great when you're staying for a week. The staff was very solicitous and friendly and brought anything we needed quickly. The room set-up wasn't very convenient for more than one person working or dining - there was a small desk, a desk chair and a big armchair. They were happy to bring us an extra chair, but it was still crowded - funny, given the size of the room. Also, the TV didn't pull out or swivel, so if you wanted to watch TV and eat dinner, you had to eat on the bed. Not that important and not the kind of thing you would care about during a short stay - but for a longer stay, it was a little inconvenient. Speaking of the bed - I'm not usually fussy about mattresses, but I personally found our bed the most uncomfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. Too hard for me and it took nearly a week after our stay for the kink to disappear from my neck. We were both working in the room at times and found both the wireless internet and the actual internet port very unstable. Our room was at the end of the hall, far from the elevators. If you're there for business, I would suggest staying closer to the middle, to make sure you have a good internet connection. Breakfast was included and was always a lovely continental spread. Coffee was divine and the breakfast staff were really lovely. Overall, I enjoyed our stay - I would definitely stay there again for a shorter time or a special occasion. And it's a great location - close to transit, restaurants, movie theatre, live theatre, etc.

Reviews.Title: “the only place I stay when in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sungeek
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and find myself in Toronto about ten times a year. My home base is in California and usually by the time I arrive at hotel le germain Iâ€™m very tired and ready to hit the sack. This is when I find the first of the three things I love about the hotel: the bed. The pillows are soft and pliable, the comforter warm and cozy and the mattress is like sleeping on a cloud. In the morning I awake and experience the second joy of le germain: the shower. Itâ€™s an unbelievable cascade of overhead water (not from the side as most conventional showers) that warms you through and through. Then, itâ€™s on to the third thing I love at the hotel: the free breakfast. Crepes, fresh fruit, muffins, cheeses and nuts served by some of the nicest people Iâ€™ve ever met. I love the germainâ€¦ and after staying at other hotels in the area wonâ€™t ever go back to them again. The price point is perfect for the services I receive.

Reviews.Title: “Have Baby Will Travel”
Reviews.Author: Wheezfixr
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Le Germain with my wife and 6-week-old son for a short mini-holiday and conference. I have tosay that I was most impressed with the staff and their incredible attention to detail. Like previous reviewers with kids, they set up a crib, diaper disposal, baby wipes, shampoos and lotions as well as a place setting for toddlers. Amazing help from the front lobby right to my room. They were extremely helpful in locating a little known resteraunt that I only heard about from a previous visit to Toronto. Breakfast was great with lattes, warm crepes and fresh fruit, all included with your stay. I cant say enough about how comfortable my stay was. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but!!”
Reviews.Author: Philly413
Reviews.Content: This really is a great hotel and within walking distance or a short subway ride away of everything that we wanted to visit. The rooms are nicely decorated and welcoming and the bed is very comfortable. The breakfast each morning is more than adequate with different items each day. You can have breakfast delivered to your room if you don't wish to go downstairs to the breakfast area. The roof top terrace is a nice place to sit during the day in the sun or for watching the city lights at night. They also have complimentary wine tasting on the terrace on Friday and Saturday afternoons from 4 -6 during the summer. The Lobby/Library is a relaxing place to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee as they have a nice coffee machine. The one and only complaint that I have about the hotel is the noise from the clubs across the street until 3 in the morning. They supply earplugs but even they don't do the trick. We knew that this was problem from other reviews and having stayed at this hotel before. If you stay on the north side of the hotel it's very quiet as hotel is very quiet within the hotel. Last visit we were on the quiet side and requested this again when we booked this visit. several months in advance as we were going to the Just for Laughs festival. We also followed up with an e-mail to the concierge a few days before we arrived. Unfortunately, I guess everyone does the same as their were no rooms available on that side of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again but ONLY if we can guarantee a room facing King Street. Otherwise what's the point of booking the Luxury Retreat room if you feel like you're trying to sleep on a club dance floor.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: designfanatic
Reviews.Content: The positives of this hotel: *Friendly staff *Nicely designed lobby that offers a nice latte/coffee machine, as well as a large library of coffee table books. *Computer use in lobby *Nice restaurant (not open all day) *Good location near CN tower, in entertainment district, lots of theater, restaurants and across the street from Second City comedy and also a few clubs. *Shoppers Drug Mart around the corner (pharmacy and sundries) *Nice large rain shower with great water pressure with glass into the bedroom (options to close the wooden blinds.) *Good quality sheets, bed may be comfortable to most. *Normal size blow dryer Negatives: *No lounge, they offer beer and wine at an honour table in the lobby. *Breakfast is meager (toast, meager fruit, cereal, juice and crepe) *Front reception area smelled of garbage backing up. *Hallway was dark feeling and damp.(may had something to do with the water leaking from the ice machine) *Rooms were very dark and millwork looking damaged and worn the same in lobby. *Earplugs next to the bed (not a good sign) There are clubs across the narrow little street, although we did not require ours perhaps because it was a weekday *Dark grey ceiling all cracked and stained. *1 electrical plug, have fun finding it, it must be a game. *No slippers in the room although can be requested *Aveda bath products although that may be a positive for some Overall this was not a horrible hotel. I think it is overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “best baby friendly hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: bacaboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 11 month old daughter while I was in Toronto on business. The hotel set up the room with a crib, diaper pail, toddler friendly plates and cutlery. The hotel staff was excellent, friendly, helpful. The rooms are beautiful and even though you are in club central, you can't hear anything at all at night. I can't say enough good about this place. I am a loyal guest from now on...

Reviews.Title: “(Almost) perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: NYCNY1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two days for leisure. Location perfectly suited just around the corner of the CN Tower. Room was very stylish and in absolute proper condition. Staff very friendly and helpful. Despite the fact that the hotel is located next to the Entertainment District, we hadn't had an issue with noise. The only negative experience: We scheduled a wine tasting event with the Restaurant Manager of the hotel restaurant (Chez Victor), but eventually he did not show up. So we asked him what is the issue? His answer: He had to take care about the restaurant. No excuse, nothing. Not very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffy_dazzler
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning hotel. Very modern yet inviting feel to it. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and exciting with the peek-a-boo shower. All the detail of the room is clean, contempory yet very cosy. The mini bar options are pretty extensive, I was suprised that there is even oxygen there. The room I stayed in was a shower room and the whole bathroom was massive in comparison to many hotels I have stayed with nice little touches as the hidden(ish) cupboard with the hairdryer and a makeup/shaving mirror. All the reviews about how fantastic the bed linen is spot on, absolute bliss. There is a 'terrace' to smoke on up on the 11th floor which is nice but it was very windy when i was up there. Also a nice little touch that i had never come accross before is instead of hanging a "do not disturb" sign on the door there is a little switch in the room. Bad Points: 1.) I came back to the room at 14:30 and the room had not yet be turned down. However when I told the staff of this the next day they comped all my mini bar expenses so not all bad at all. 2.) The breakfast everyone seems to rave about I thought was incredibly sub-standard for the price I was paying. Although the cheeses and bread were lovely it would have been nice to see some meat protein and some more hot dishes such as eggs (the only eggs were hard boiled) 3.) No ipod dock or flat screen which i would expect from such a contempory hotel Those bad points though are minor in comparison to the enjoyment of all the great points of this hotel. I would never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel, Not the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: cubalibre3
Reviews.Content: Le Germain is a beautiful hotel. Very sexy -- with glass shower that looks into the bedroom. Definitely book the room directly through the hotel because they have specials all the time. The only problem with this hotel is its location. It is between the business district and the entertainment district, so there aren't so many things to do or see during the day. They sometimes offer complimentary breakfast, which just continental from what I could tell. The staff were very nice in person, but over the phone when I was negotiating between two deals, they were a bit annoyed, but professional none the less. I would highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind being a bit away from stuff. Honestly, we wouldn't have minded much, but we relied on a friend who lives there to show us around, when we would have been better offer learning the sites to see before we went.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: gd78
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious (even if the plasma TV was someway not working fine) and the bathroom very nice. However in the area the are a lot of discos and during the night you cuold hear a very loud music.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but so what!”
Reviews.Author: IzPoti
Reviews.Content: Look, we love this hotel. We have stayed there before. The staff are friendly, the rooms are great, the bathroom is wonderful, but so what!!! You are in the middle of Disco City. When I tried to go to sleep the other night, there was a boom-boom-boom coming out of the club next door which was like one of those idiots with a boombox for a car parked on my pillow. It's a shame. We love it, but I don't think we'll ever stay there again. It was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFlygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Le Germain. The office booked our room so we were not prepared for the experience. The only complaint I can come up with is the location. I'm not sure I'd feel comfortable walking in the neighborhood at night. That being said, daytime you're close to King street and the subway as well as shopping and everything else. The subway system got me across town in a flash! You're also within walking distance of the ball park. We loved the room, the added extras such as bottled water, chocolates, bose sound system and high end bathroom amenities. The unique floor-to-ceiling windowed shower was a surprise, especially to our business associates (two men) who found it freaky! (the window covering opens from the bedroom side). The outside of the building is misleading as others have mentioned (former warehouse) but as soon as you're inside, your impression changes. We loved the breakfast which provided everything buffet style but in a very nice atmosphere as well as the lobby bar/library with fireplace. It was very welcoming and cosy, along with internet access. I'd stay at Le Germain again anytime I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love the Germain”
Reviews.Author: mizzie
Reviews.Content: Having stayed twice at this hotel in the last couple of months, it is hard to want to stay anywhere else. The first time we stayed, I actually extended the stay by 2 days because of the luxury. The most recent stay, we stayed for 5 days, and the luxury continued. We have only stayed in the Luxury suites, and for the extra dollars (which was not that much), it is one of the nicest suites ever stayed in. From the efficient and friendly door and check in staff to the extra's found in the room, I will only consider the le Germain on my trips to Toronto. For movie/TV buffs, the 50 inch plasma TV in the Luxury Theater room is a huge bonus. The king size bed and the luxurious bedding is one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in...we even wondered how we could sneak the bedding and pillows out...BUT...you can purchase these on their website for an incredibly reasonable price. All in all, from the staff, to room itself, the le Germain is an oasis!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
