Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with a great lobby. Rooms spacious and with all the luxury you can wish for with great palsma screen tv etc. Pity the area around it is not so nice..although there is a great theatre opposite the street where we went one evening for a comedian show.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: tommytraveller
Reviews.Content: Very rarely do you pay top dollar and then realise you have fantastic value for money-this was one occasion. From the moment the doorman welcomed us with a hand shake till the minute we left, nothing was too much for the wonderful and knowledgable staff. The highlight was the room , including bathroom. We like modern and this was up there with the best in Barcelona,,which I think has the chicest hotels. Bed,lights, decor, Bose sound deck, TV, shower and thoughtful facilities designed by a woman for women, particulalrly in the bathroom- all so very tasteful. Breakfast just perfect, library and huge log fire in a modern style so relaxing! Look no further, if its chic, friendly, clean and modern that you like, book now!

Reviews.Title: “a bit disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Steviem71
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed in Le Germain. I had the impression that it was a new hotel but the rooms already seem a little dated. The TV isn't flat screen, there's no iPod dock and the decor in general feels a bit cheap. The toilet door didn't even close fully. Staff were very helpful but for the price and in comparison to the other hotels I stayed in around Canada on my trip I expected a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JoeKo18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel on out wedding night. The lobby is small but the front desk staff were courteous and check-in was fast (It should have been at 1am!). The room was very clean and modern and of average size. The bathroom was nice and large, but my wife thought the peek-a-boo shower was weird. Overall nice hotel, but nothing spectacular and very expensive. I think you can find a better stay elsewhere for the price, or a the same stay at a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gunnarh
Reviews.Content: The staff was very attentive, helpful, and pleasant. The room was amazing. In fact, the air conditioning in our first room wasn't working well enough for our tastes (we like it ice cold). Without any hesitation, they found another room for us and it was phenomenal. The room was quiet. The bathroom was well-appointed, the decor was hip and comfortable. The breakfast each morning was delicious and a real treat. It also was nice to have the Internet access in the lobby library. We'd definitely stay here again...we really felt spoiled the whole time we were here. The central location proved to be very convenient, too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor; you might need the complimentary earplugs”
Reviews.Author: jiuyen
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is off the beaten path, located on a "just off the main road" back road in a very trendy part of town. I was surprised when the taxi stopped and thought, "This can't be location, can it?" But then I saw the nice entrance and waiting staff, and I knew I was in the right place. As others have mentioned, the decor is high modern. Like the W and other hotels adopting the "trendy" theme, green apples were used as decorations. I was told that the hotel was a converted warehouse. The good: * Room service was great. The food I ordered arrived promptly (within the 45 minutes quoted) and was delicious. * The room included plenty of creature comforts: complementary bottles of water (with an ice bucket filled every night), fluffy bath robes, a Bose radio, and Aveda products in the bathroom. * The working space was more than adequate. The desk in my room was surrounded by other flat surfaces that made it easy to spread out my paperwork. * At check-in, the staff was top notch. They had guessed who I might be and already started the process before I reached the desk. * Above-ground walking distance to lots of fun, small restaurants and bars (not connected to the series of underground passageways that make moving from building to building in Toronto in the winter easier). The not-so-good: * My room was on the street side, overlooking a little bar that had rooftop seating and, on one night, a movie playing outdoors. Fun, right? Also loud. Luckily, earplugs are provided. I was on the 9th floor, so the noise wasn't as distracting as it might have been, and I didn't have any problems sleeping. I am sure that this is not an issue in the Toronto winters! * I checked out at an odd time (6:30AM on a Saturday morning), and the staff was unprepared. I was running late, so I called downstairs to ask them to begin the process during my elevator ride. No one answered the phone. When I arrived at the desk, no one was there, and the bellman had to search for the gentlemen manning it. When he arrived, I mentioned that no one had answered my call. He never apologized, but provided an excuse: this was the time during which he did his paperwork.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: PenA1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Germain for 6 nights in June 2007 - our first holiday to Toronto. In summary, the hotel was very clean, in a good location, the staff very helpful and overall, we were very happy with our stay. We stayed in a deluxe room (1006) which looked out of the back of the hotel which gave good views over the entertainment district. The room was very clean, tidy and of course the bathroom with the window into the room. We tried the room service which gave very large portions and well worth the money - especially after a hard day of sightseeing. Our rate included breakfast which was buffet style and always stocked plentifully with homecooked pastries, pancakes, muffins and also cereal, fruit, yogurt etc. During our stay, I celebrated my birthday. Upon our return to our room, there was a handwritten card from the conceirge and a handmade cake waiting for me. We didn't tell the hotel that it was birthday - it must have been the maid who noticed the birthday cards in the room. We used the conceirge to book a tour to Niagara Falls and a town car back to the airport. In both instances, they gave us the information and let us decide. They then organised everything on our behalf. The hotel is in a good location for the many restaurants and cafes of the entertainment district, the CN Tower, the Roger's Centre and the lake front.The Eaton Centre is within walking distance, and there are many streetcars that stop in the vicinity. We have stopped in many hotels around the world, and this is one of the best - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: go_extreme
Reviews.Content: WOW..def the best hotel I have ever been to. It was my husbands b-day so we went to RAIN restaurant and then I suprised him with the 1 night stay at this very stylish yet simple boutique hotel. The view from the room and 11th floor patio were amazing. We were able to watch the CN lights at night! Love the music at the patio and you can smoke as well as drink there any time of day. Another favorite thing - the green apples when you walk out of the elevators..the Aveda products, the mini bar and the little sexy packages for some fun. The bed in our room was huge..Loved the shower(and that you can watch from your bed :-) ) - I call it the Niagra Falls shower .... I spent at least 20 min The breakfast is very good. And you can have free LATTE any time of day at the library. I can just go on for hours...I was really impressed wtih everything...staff..valet parking...how clean it was... can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, yet still warm -- one of the very best”
Reviews.Author: CantabCambridge_MA
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in the Le Germaine recently and though my stay was brief it was memorable. The hotel's decor is modern & stylish but still very warm, like the treatment I received from the front desk personnel and the concierge. The highlight of my stay was the room. I stayed in a Luxury Room. The dark wood tones coupled with the sophisticated lighting made for a stunning room. The room was spacious, with an incredibly comfortable king-sized bed, a chaise lounge, and a great walk-in shower in the bathroom. The shower has a rainfall showerhead and since the room's ceilings were 10-12 feet, it truly felt like rainfall! This was the nicest room (in a contemporary hotel) that I've ever stayed in, including stays at multiple W hotels in different cities. The small gym was well-equipped and the hotel has a great terrace on the 11th floor. The hotel is located in the entertainment district so there are the cute restaurants of King St nearby and lots of lounges & nightclubs also.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: partyofsix
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Attention to detail is such a nice touch. After check in they remembered my name every staff member calls you by name when you enter the lobby! Our room glasswear was in french when we checked in at turn down they where in english! The management sent cookies and a g/c for chez victor to our room for my husband's birthday. Everyone was so great and so nice. The rooms are wonderful! So comfty the sheets are to die for! Every amentie you can image. First class all the way! I highly recommend this hotel if you are in town for a special occasion, or a want a romantic retreat for your stay we could not have asked for more. I've stayed at some very nice hotels and now le germain is the standard! Harbour house in NOTL was nice but nothing compared to this place. We had a tub and shower and my husband LOVED the shower i enjoyed the tub. And the peek a boo glass in the bathroom is very fun. It's pricey and so worth it. I did'nt feel cheated or let down at all. I would'nt consider another hotel on our next trip to toronto the location was terrific! Right in the heart of the downtown entertainment district.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing else comes close...”
Reviews.Author: cstaples
Reviews.Content: I stay here up to 30 nights a year on business. I chose Le Germain after trying virtually every other hotel in Toronto-- from the Four Seasons to the Drake and everything in between. No other hotel has nicer rooms, friendlier staff or a better breakfast buffet. The only things Le Germain could improve are the room service menu (the current one is a bit esoteric) and the gym (a bit small). Everything else is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This is such a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSPrima
Reviews.Content: I really love this love this hotel. I've already planned my next trip back. The staff is super friendly and competent. A rare combination. The concierge consistently delivered on what they said they were going to do. My room was elegant, simple and functional.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Antheia
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Toronto for business. I always check Tripadvisor before booking any hotel. The reviews were mixed, as you can read. I like the pictures so much I thought I would give it a try. I stay at hotels often from the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton to boutique hotels like Hotel Le Germain. This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at! I have stayed at 5 star hotels in the US, Paris, Rome and Switzerland. I am the ultimate critic, this place surpasses the word, superb. Wow!! Room 611is unbelievable, I assume all the rooms are equal in quality and decor. The bed is huge and comfortable, the bathroom incredible. One wall in the bathroom is glass with wooden blinds so that they can be closed or open. This wall is the the shower wall where you can look directly to the bed from the bathroom. I have never seen a room designed in this manner. It was very cool! I never take a bath in a public tub, this one you could have eaten off of it. The tub was trimmed in black slate, the shower head powerful with multiple settings. One thing I noticed, that towels smelled and looked so clean. I only remember the Four Seasons as having towels that are comparable and not at all Four Seasons. I sometimes travel with my own towels since they never seem to smell clean and I always attriute this to diluted detergent. These towels were clean, soft and fragrant. The details were incomparable to any place I have ever been. Recessed lights, custom furniture. The library has a computer and printer where I printed my color presentation for free. The living rooms downstairs have comfortable white couches with a cozy fireplace. The staff were exceptionally courteous; they went over and above to ensure I had everything. There was an expresso machine for complimentary capaccino, expresso, tea, coffee, etc. in the library and in the breakfast room. The breakfast spread had salmon, black olives, fresh pastries including croissants, jellies, fresh fruit, crepes, everything. You can order any type of coffee you want they make it right there. I felt like I was at Starbucks, but better. Simply superb. I was amazed at the attention to detail. I told my husband that I would return to Toronto just so that he could experience this hotel. I didn't want to leave! Dinner: Dinner at Rodney's oyster bar. I sampled different oysters from various parts of the world. The fish dinner and beer selections fantastic! If you like fresh seafood, you'll love Rodney's. I can't say enough about this hotel. I hope that someday I can return. I wish I could only have shared this experience with a family member or friend. This is how exception Hotel Le Germain really is.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: hatehardpillows
Reviews.Content: When I walked in to the hotel the lobby looked very nice and aroused interest in how the rest of it will look like. The room was all right, but not special in comparison to other hotels I'd been to in Toronto. The overall location is OK, but it is in a random side street, and the entrance's location is a bit incognito. There was a big window in the room, looking to some office buildings windows, and nothing more. Sort of like having your view blocked by bricks. When I stayed at the Toronto Hilton, they had gorgeous view in comparison. The toiletries were pretty bad - I personally don't like Rosemary Mint (Aveda). It's the least favorite toiletries I had so far in any hotel. The menu was extremely small and a little too complicated. The staff was very friendly, but did strike me a bit amateur. My heating was making a bad sound and I had to call them several times about it, and then changed rooms. The gym could have been a bit better. Their wine selection is very good. Their self-served breakfast is very nice and cozy. In general, The hotel is OK, but if you're looking for something special, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: busymomtraveller
Reviews.Content: This amazing boutique hotel is in the heart of the theatre district in Toronto. When you get out of your car, the friendly valet service escorts you into the chic lobby, of course with a real fire burning in the glass enclosed fireplace, to the front desk, where once again you are greeted by friendly, smiling faces. We were checked in very quickly, given all the info for the special occasion, as it was New Years Eve. When we entered our room, it was exactly as it looked on the internet. Absolutely amazing!! I cannot express how wonderful this hotel is. I've stayed at some of the best hotels in the world, including the Ritz in Paris, and this one ranks with them!! They had a wonderful brunch for New Years day, which was included in the price of our room!! Unbelievable!!! The entire staff are truly over the top with every detail covered. I wish we could have stayed longer! We will definitely be staying there again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon, having stayed in the Soho Metropolitan at the beginning of our trip. Le Germain was superior in every way. We were extremely impressed that, for such a large hotel, they made a special effort for our honeymoon, providing complementary breakfast in bed, a card from the Concierge and a pair of glasses engraved with the room number. Our room was beautiful and extremely well appointed. The glass-fronted bathroom was fabulous and could only have been improved with the addition of a bath in addition to the walk-in shower. After our special welcome, we found the staff helpful and attentive throughout. The only let down was the restaurant, where the food was overpriced and average quality; the breakfast was also not quite as good as we'd expected given the quality elsewhere. If you avoid the restaurant, though, this is a really beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this place a lot”
Reviews.Author: SurfJogger
Reviews.Content: Stylish, modern hotel. The rooms are nice. Upscale, modern looking, maybe pretentious, furniture. Big, elegant bathrooms. Staff was helpful and the location was perfect -- most of the key points of interest are within walking distance. Good restaurants are nearby. The hotel's own restaurant is also nice, if pricey. My only complaint -- no draft beer. Breakfast is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, amateur staff”
Reviews.Author: monttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot of potential. The rooms are very good, stylish, spacious, well appointed and quiet with great bathrooms. Breakfast is very good. However, the hotel staff are hopelessly amateur. The front desk staff didn't know where the Ontario Art Gallery was nor when the hotel's restaurant 'Chez Victor' opened (in fact they got it wrong). The bar staff were slow, not customer-focused and not very competent (someone should tell them a martini with a twist is not a martini with a slice of lemon stuck on the side of the glass....- when you're charging $15 - get it right!). This hotel charges 4 star rates and has 4 star rooms, but has 2 star staff. For the money, one can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Still as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: JohnTheGeologist
Reviews.Content: We had first stayed in Le Germain a few months after the hotel had opened in 2003; this time the hotel had added a restaurant, a gym and a larger mezzanine breakfast area. The rooms are clean and modern with a lot of dark wood, a powerful glass-enclosed shower, and a very large bed with Frette linen. We didn't need the optional DVD player, as the hotel has a very large list of current movies on-demand through the TV. The staff are polite and helpful, with an added touch of French-Canadien charm and laid-back urban cool. The double-height lobby is a great place to relax with a drink, catch up on emails or just people watch. The continental breakfasts were good - I can particularly recommend the cinnamon buns! The restaurant menu looked interesting, but unfortunately the restaurant was fully booked the evening we tried to eat there. However the hotel is just a minute away from King St W and the variety of eateries there. We didn't go hungry! I would not hesitate to stay there on my next trip to TO.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Choice”
Reviews.Author: clydethetraveller
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular in Toronto for business living in New York and have stayed at most of the higher end/luxury properties. While it isn't a match for the Four Seasons, it's a stylish choice, with a great downtown location in the entertainment district, with very luxe rooms (comfy duvet, soothing modern color scheme, great glass showers). Although the service may not live up to 5-star standards, if you can get a decent price on the rooms, it's an excellent choice for business and leisure travellers. (in comparison, however, the Soho Met accross the street is a better, if somewhat more expensive choice).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Cozy with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jasperfrog
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel based on feedback left on Tripadvisor and I'm so glad that I did. The place is stylish, yet cosy. The rooms are an absolute treat - the Frette linen on the bed is amazing, the size of the room was bigger than we expected and the bathroom was wonderful with an amazing rainfall shower - you may never want to leave the room, but if you do, make sure you indulge in the complimentary breakfast, which kept us going throughout the day. The hotel reception is very trendy and all the staff are dressed in impeccably. Everyone was friendly, courteous and overall very professional. The lounge area has a lovely 'bar' corner and shelves of books that you want to pick and browse through. Toronto is an amazing city and this hotel fits in so well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMalloy
Reviews.Content: I've been to T.O. more times than I can remember, and have stayed at many fine hotels. This one's nice, but certainly not the best (check out the Four Seasons in Yorkville for that). Yes, the room is very good - deep soaking tub, rain like shower, plenty of towels and amenities. The LCD TV is awful, as it's very complicated to get the DVD player to work, nor can you adjust the television screen (it's like they de-activated those buttons...?) - and the picture is not great. My room, a suite, came with both a empty fridge and a bar fridge, nice touch. Unfortunately all the creamers in the fridge had gone bad. Not great when you have people over for a meeting and you find out the hard way. Maybe it's because they had turned the fridge to its lowest setting...? The service is just plain wrong though. Awful. The reservation system was always "down", nor do they make any attempt to call you back after leaving repeated messages. Front Desk told me "half hour till your room is ready" and left me waiting in the lobby well over an hour with no update. The valet guys who got my car for me upon checking out were too busy fighting to notice I was standing there. My suite had a terrific balcony, huge. But be warned, they only seem to exist on the 7th floor. Room service? Yes, it exists but not for breakfast (please explain that to me...). If you want an ideal location, great room and fantastic service, try the Four Seasons in Yorkville. The prices for a suite are much, much cheaper and you can't go wrong there. Le Germain's bathrooom has them beat, but the Four Seasons wins on everything else by a mile. I would not return, not when I can get far, far better for much less.

Reviews.Title: “reason enough to go to toronto”
Reviews.Author: lesliek
Reviews.Content: absolutely fabulous. chic, elegant, great service, fabulous design, incredibly comfortable, spacious rooms. i'm looking for an excuse to return to toronto just to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: MGSUCH
Reviews.Content: My now husband and I came to Toronto to get married and stayed at Le Germain. The staff greeted us by name when we walked up to the counter. When they found out why were there they sent turffles, glasses etched with our room number and a certificate for breakfast in bed to our room. The room was beautiful and spacious. The bathroom was amazing. The shower was a giant rainfall showerhead that was not to be believed. This is an exquisite hotel. They made our wedding trip all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Chic”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: Having never been in Toronto we were quite pleased at this hotel. It is clearly a "boutique" hotel in every sense of the word. The room was very large, with a flat screen T.V. and huge bathroom. Service was impeccable - as good as any 5 star hotel we have been in. The front desk went out of their way to help, and the maids were there almost before you left the room. Of course they had turn down service and chocolates on the pillow, but also nice touches like a bottle of water by your bed in case you are thirsty late at night. Since the hotel is in the entertainment/fashion district they give you ear plugs for the night noise. We were on the 4th floor and only heard some music one night; I am a very light sleeper and it did not bother me. If you can afford it (yes, the place is pricy) it is well worth the extra money to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “little bit late night street noise”
Reviews.Author: larkoolaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Germain is a very relaxing hotel in a good location if you are interested in checking out all the various neigborhoods and sights. It is in the entertainment district so late night noise is heard. We were on the highest floor and could still hear music and talking late into the night. The hotel does provide earplugs but the best earplugs can be found at Target- made out of wax. We used these and all was good. Obviously we heard the normal street sounds in the morning- construtions, etc- but it is a big city! The complimentary breakfast is very nice and the servers are very polite and helpful. The actual dining area for breakfast is nice but with a cafeteria/business feel to it-- but oh well. The lobby is nice with great art books and free internet. Rooms are nice- great beds- bathrooms are a bit dark but nice- hallways to rooms are kinda ugly- but who hangs out in hallways. Only disappointing issue was the workout room. Really small and only one machine had a tv to work out to. I assume they were working on the others or replacing them.

Reviews.Title: “Le Germain - A slightly confusing experience”
Reviews.Author: melycapa
Reviews.Content: I treated my boyfriend to a night at Le Germain in February of this year. We had a great time luxuriating in bed (sheets are divine) but also had a few problems. One, the valet parking was quite confusing. I was driving my car, and my boyfriend was in the passenger seat. As it was pouring rain, the doorman came to the car, opened the passenger door and escorted my boyfriend to the door. He didn't come back for me!! So I hopped out of the car, grabbed the bags and made a mad dash for the lobby in the rain. (somewhat embarassing!) The same thing happened on the way out for dinner - The valet guy opened the passenger side door for my boyfriend and didn't do the same for me! In the morning, we received a SPECTACULAR breakfast in bed which we pre-ordered the night before. It was perfect, and the coffee was awesome. Don't be shy to order anything off the menu - we realized too late that we should have ordered a bit more. (it's just one price for the whole spread) We had paid for the late checkout, (3 pm) but around 12.30 pm, there was a rattling of the door, and a bellboy appeared in our room uninvited!! I was quite shocked to see him as I was quite unclothed at the time! The mini bar is very well stocked albeit expensive - we indulged in the portable oxygen tank for an extra 15 dollars. An interesting experience, but I didn't really feel that it made much of a difference. All in all, we had a good time hanging out, eating breakfast and being together - Hopefully the valet guys will get their act together and the communication between the front desk and the bellboys will improve!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: carolinamcb_12
Reviews.Content: After spending many hours researching Toronto hotels for our first two nights of honeymoon (early December) before heading to sunnier climes, my husband booked Le Germain. We were thrilled with our experience. The staff were friendly, attentive to detail~ (providing me with a vase for my bouquet) and they went above and beyond. The room was very tastefully decorated and I love the Aveda products in the bathroom:) We wish we could take up residence and sigh every time we pass it now... maybe another few nights for our 1st anniversary...I'll start hinting now.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: I treated my wife to a stay at Le Germain for her birthday, and I practically had to drag her out of the room the next morning. It was stunning, from the decor -- dark wood, high ceilings, luxurious bed, comfortable chairs, beautiful bathroom -- to the service. The staff was professional and thorough, check-in/out was quick, the lobby and library are gorgeous...even the continental breakfast was impressive! I also *highly* recommend eating downstairs at Luce if you have the chance. Be sure to book a table when you make your reservation. It's not a cheap hotel, but I'd recommend it over the comparably-priced Soho Met any day of the week. That said, if you stay at Le Germain for a second night, you might want to sneak over to the Soho Met for a meal at Senses!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could Live there”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbeth
Reviews.Content: We picked Le Germain after reading about it on Trip Advisor. It is pricey! But worth it. Huge walk in shower (no bath tub) and a "continental" breakfast to DIE for. Smoked Salmon, cappuccino, fresh fruit like berries and pineapple, crepes. Free papers and not just the National Post! Also a wonderful cozy lobby/sitting room with a wood fire and free internet access in the sitting room. Aveda toiletries, free bottled water and granny smith apples everywhere, and lovely robes. Can't wait to go back but have to save my pennies first! We went to Second city as it is right down the street. That was great too! :)

Reviews.Title: “dreamy.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am so thrilled to be giving a hotel such a wonderful review. My husband and I are from NYC and travel often. We are PICKY to say the least. I can honestly say I could find no fault with this luxurious little boutique hotel. The rooms were very spacious and user-friendly. They really paid attn to detail with the make-up mirror in the bathroom, to the excellent use of storage/closet space. The Frette sheets made me want to stay in bed all day. Hotel staff always friendly and helpful. A few restaurants to recommend: Trattoria Giancarlo in Little Italy is fabulous and rustic and intimate. JK Wine Bar was really fun and delicious--definitely go for the small plates and sit at the very comfprtable bar rather than reserving a table with the more traditional dinner menu. You'll love it and Toronto is a fantastic city. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: lbdivorcelaw
Reviews.Content: What a perfect weekend at Le Germain. The lobby is minimalist and comfortable at the same time. The concierge helped me with finding shopping in TO...but it was the room that made the stay. Great closet space, bathrooms to die for, perfect bedding, tons of cable channels, windows that open and a view of the CN Tower. The free breakfast was a perfect way to start the day. Really, I am a tough critic on hotels, but this worth every penny - and it is a pricey place to stay. If you are going to TO - which is a great city, don't overlook Le Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: makis1
Reviews.Content: When you stay here you feel really good. Especially when coming from the Metropolitan Toronto. It is very well worth the extra few dollars for a little peace of heaven. This was my second stay here and this time I got the "Deluxe" room over the "Superior" (standard). Wow what a difference 50 sq feet makes. The lobby is fantastic and soothing with a real wood burning fireplace. The design of the hotel is nice but what set's it apart are the materials. equisite woods and stone and stylish concrete. The bathrooms are fun with the rain shower and peekaboo wall to the main bedroom. Location is great as well right downtown but just off the main streets. One minor issue was that the room was not ready on time but hey I made the booking that morning so maybe it's ok. PS the Aveda Products are a nice bonus

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and let down by some service howlers, but generally OK”
Reviews.Author: KeithTalent
Reviews.Content: Nearly gave this 2 out of 5 following some incompetance and rudeness at checkout, but to be fair it's not that bad. Good lobby (no bar though, which is a let down for a boutique hotel), breakfast fine (coffee terrible - throw that machine away!), rooms well designed (although only showers - why no baths?). Biggest problem for me was the noise - lots of construction nearby, and this is in the heart of the Entertainment District. This has its advantages, as it's only a short walk to numerous bars and restaurants, but there is late night noise. They provide earplugs in the rooms, but there is no double-glazing. So lightsleepers should not apply!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Toronto. Nice hotel, modern amenities. Very clean and comfortable..Very neat bathroom. I stayed at this hotel for three days. From the moment I arrived they did everything to make my stay enjoyable. The rooms were impeccable. The beds were so comfortable and the pillows too...made it hard to want to get up in the morning. The shower was great too...u didn't want to get out of the shower either. The hotel was in a great location...close to shops, the CN tower, Harbourfront...and plenty of restaurants...if you like night life then this hotel is for you...you are close to several bars and clubs. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone.....and I will stay here again should I travel to Toronto....Also the conceirge was so helpful...extremly professional and dedicated to making your stay nice...her name is Marie-Eve Balla. She is very helpful in recommending things to do, to make reservations...no task to big or to small...I hope you stay here you won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things at Le Germain Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: SandyB
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend stay at Le Germain Hotel in Toronto (although the changing exchange rate between the American and Canadian dollar made it more expensive than we'd anticipated). First of all, it has a fabulous location in the middle of the Entertainment district. We enjoy walking and, from Le Germain, we were able to foot it to Queen Street, Kensington Martket, Chinatown, and even Little Italy. (We enjoy a more neighborhoody, authentic experience, so stayed away from the Bloor Street high couture thing.) We had a standard Queen room, but found it absolutely wonderful. Nothing standard about it -- the best bed I think I've ever slept in, outfitted with high count cotton sheets, down comforter, 4 huge down pillows ... ahhh. There was a large comfortable chair with a large, soft throw, for curling up and reading. One side of the shower is a glass wall (visible from the room, with blinds for the more discrete). The shower itself is wonderful with a choice of either a ceiling rainshower or hand-held shower head that can be attached to a lower level (for shorter people, or those who don't want to wash their hair). There were shelves and cubby holes everywhere in the large room that enabled you to spread out and really claim the space. Also, there were many large drawers and two closets for hanging articles, which also had shelves. There were many small touches throughout the room that showed alot of thought had gone into the design -- for example, a 3-way mirror mounted on the wall at face level that opened like a cabinet and, below that, a drop down shelf to hold make-up or whatever. Also, the lighting was varied and generous. I (as opposed to another post) enjoyed the breakfast food: coffee, expresso, juice, homemade jams, hard-boiled eggs, breads, pastries, bagels, croissants, fruits(citrus' membranes removed), crepes, muesli ... dunno what else you could want, unless you were looking for fried food. There were two servers who were helping all the while and remembered the next day that I liked cappucino with extra milk and brought it over immediately. A nice and welcomed touch. The lobby has two levels with a glassed-in fireplace separating the two burning real wood, as well as a laptop connected to the internet, comfortable furniture, a floor-to-ceiling library, and a free expresso machine. I would term the decor as european sleek, but very comfortable. The hotel staff is young, extremely polite, and eager to please. They've obviously been well-trained. There was also a free, fitness room on the top floor with a weight machine, two treadmills, and an eliptical trainer. All the cardio machines had individual TVs. I found the one drawback being the concierge desk. They tried to be helpful, but really weren't well versed in the city. I was wondering about a few places I had read about in various travel books, and they weren't familiar with them. They were very responsive with specific requests like restaurant reservations. I asked my questions elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last June and found it excellent. The rooms are chic and very comfortable, and we enjoyed the generous continental breakfast in the gallery. The lobby is stunning, and the restaurant (Luce) very good. We didn't consult the concierge so can't comment, but overall, we had no reason to complain about the service. In any case, the service here was better than at the Soho Metropolitan, where we also stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - but nice from a distance.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked a special weekend as a Birthday suprise for my husband (who usually does all the holiday booking) at first I was really pleased to read the reviews and especially the Conde Nast Hip Hotel Award. Sadly, at first glance the hotel certainly did look good and hip. However, the room was damp, there was no room service, a concierge desk that was never manned, and really no atmosphere of anything vaguely hip (except perhaps the art books in the lounge). The rooms looked good and the bed really comfortable - finally after having requested the bedding being changed again nearer bedtime as the air conditioning created damp bedding during the course of the day. A plasma screen TV in the suite was nice, but not tuned in correctly and therefore a fuzzy picture was the best to hope for and the DVD not connected to the TV, which was strange since they charge for DVD rental! 4 workmen later in the room on 3 separate days did nothing to solve these problems. The coffee (only available in the lounge on a help yourself basis) was nice. Breakfast was help yourself but limited to bakery and cereal and in a room more suited to a conference facility. Earplugs in the room might make some worry at the noise levels, but this was fine. The Aveda bathroom goodies were a nice touch. In fact, everything looked good at first glance, but as a guest/user of the faciities it did not live up to expectations and already looking worn around the edges. Calling for the Manager who says "i'll be with you in a minute" and then takes 40 minutes is never going to be a good sign at customer satisfaction. Would I go back? NO. Did husband enjoy his birthday surprise? Politely he said Toronto was nice. Later he admitted the hotel left him more stressed that before he got there!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of erroneous charges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel's bar, called LUCE, is not bad, but the waiter had made an "upward" error on our check. Once it was pointed out to him, he advised us to just sign the top copy of the credit card receipt. The charge posting to our credit card was inflated even more - because in addition to making an original error the waiter has added himself a tip of 22%. So beware of having to pay CAD20 for a coctail priced at CAD12. Also, think twice before using your credit card here.

Reviews.Title: “No bar snacks??”
Reviews.Author: hoagy294
Reviews.Content: The bar is nice, the whole place is very wallpaper-y, but they have no bar snacks, no bar snacks menu, and the request threw the all-black clad staff into a bit of a tizz. I felt like I was being waited on by Dieter. Yes, we could have ordered the antipasto platter, "invented daily" and no price given on the menu, or they could spring for a bowl of almonds at the table!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInTexas
Reviews.Content: We found the Le Germain very nice, above average furnishings and amenities. The houskeeping and waite staff were very good, and the continental breakfast was also above average. The gym, although very limited, was high-tech and very nice;offering free water bottels etc. Of the two problems we had only one can be addressed by the managment. The concierge was not very good, referring to the Toronto magazine for information. (which we had of course already done), we never felt that we received fresh and usefull information. The problem they have that they cannot help, is that there is a rooftop club right across the street, and if you have a room that faces the front of the hotel, you have music and loud people till 2 am, then drunk loud people leaving the club till about 2:30 am. So all in all this is a very nice hotel, just do not depend on the concierge, and request a room facing the back of the building, just remember this hotel is in the entertainment section of Toronto, and there are clubs in every direction!

Reviews.Title: “Best chain in Canada”
Reviews.Author: RobPeixoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Germain Toronto last April. Great hotel, well modern design, delicious included breakfast, best bed I ever slept, spaciously room, marvelous shower, good location. During my 12 day vacation around Canada, this was the best hotel I stayed. The Quebec branch is as nice as the Toronto one, but more cosy and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “okay but internet is hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good looking place. Experienced similar problems with the internet. Staff didn't seem able to correct the problem - the approach they seemed to take was "well it is free." They did let me use of of there computers where the internet seemed to be all right, just not very convenient. A colleague of mine who stayed here a few months back also had a similar experience with the internet. Restaurant is really small, but there are a lot of great places in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “A Qualified Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Shemtov
Reviews.Content: A very nicely designed hotel, nice bed, rooms, bathroom, furniture, etc. Beautiful bathrobes, etc. Below the surface, things were a little shakier. The high-speed internet port in my room did not work and other than confirming that it wasn't working, nobody really tried to do anything about it and the offer of a different room was exceedingly half-hearted. Also, the temperature control system in the room wasn't working very well. All not great signs in a brand-new place.Anyway, I definitely liked their style and will definitely give it another try, but if I have similar problems next time, I will probably move on.
